title: The Virgin and Child with Four Holy Virgins
description: Maria met het Christuskind en de heiligen Catharina, Cecilia, Barbara en Ursula, zittend in een omheind hof (van een klooster?). Buiten het hof links twee mannen, waarschijnlijk Johannes en Jacobus. Rechts twee vrouwen, waarschijnlijk de heiligen Maria Magdalena en Margaretha.

iconClassDescription: the virgin martyr Catherine of Alexandria; possible attributes: book, crown, emperor Maxentius, palm-branch, ring, sword, wheel
the virgin martyr Cecilia of Rome; possible attributes: falcon, musical instruments, organ, wreath of roses and lilies
the virgin martyr Barbara; possible attributes: book, cannon(ball), crown, cross, chalice with wafer, Dioscuros (her father), peacock feather, sword, torches, mason's tools, tower
the virgin martyr Ursula of Cologne; possible attributes: arrow, banner with red cross, cloak of ermine, crown, ship

label.title: The Virgin and Child with Four Holy Virgins
label.makerLine: Master of the Virgo inter Virgines (active c. 1475-1510), Northern Netherlands, c. 1495-1500, oil on panel
label.description: This painting is an ode to chastity. The Virgin sits in an enclosed garden, a symbol of virginity, surrounded by four other virgins (‘virgo inter virgines’). From attributes on their necklaces, they are identifiable as Saint Catherine with a wheel and sword, Saint Cecilia with an organ, Saint Barbara with a tower and Saint Ursula with a heart and arrow.
